Below is a listing of all the games slated to be broadcast during the fall 2015 season. More >> SWX is proud to present another exciting year of high school football! Below is a listing of all the games slated to be broadcast during the fall 2015 season. More >> Richland, WA - 
When you think of John Lesser, you probably picture 80 yard touchdown runs for the Liberty Christian Patriots. 
But his coaches see something else: 
"I see a kid that calls me new year's morning saying can we get in the weight room and lift," says Liberty Christian Head Coach Craig Lukins. "Calling coaches Christmas morning saying hey, can you open the gym so I can get a lift in? See him taking the smallest freshman and that being his workout partner. That's the kind of leader he is, pulling up from the bottom taking the team with him." 
And that attitude has led the Patriots senior quarterback to the endzone over 100 times, and landed him multiple offers to play in college. 
"There's been offers from [division] two and three schools around here," says Lesser. "Whitworth, Willamette, and walk on opportunities at Portland State and Idaho State." 
But that's for later this year. Right now, he's more focused on lighting up defenses and winning a state championship. 
"I'm really focusing on senior year, getting it done with the team,going game by game, and getting back to the tacoma dome and winning it," says Lesser. 
But between his 3.7 GPA and the time he spends working off the field, it's his work ethic that sets him apart. 
"Always have to get your homework done. Then you get lifting in, get the team in, and I watch film about half an hour or hour in every night, get that in." 
You'll definitely see him in pads next season, and whatever teams lands him is going to get one of the hardest workers, and fastest runners, in the Tri Cities. Academic All Star: Liberty Christian's John Lesser More>>
